name: market for yarn, silk | yarn, silk | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20913/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'yarn, silk', in the Global geography.;Transport from producers to consumers of this product in the geography covered by the market is included.;This product represents a natural silk yarn made through throwing or twisting the reeled silk. It is unprocessed (without bleaching or dyeing) and can be used to weave textiles. It is produced through a handloom process.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'yarn, silk',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of 'yarn, silk',  to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/13:Manufacture of textiles/131:Spinning, weaving and finishing of textiles/1311:Preparation and spinning of textile fibres

exchanges.description: The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics.
